title: Naked bodies of mother and teen daughter found buried in abandoned house in Argentina
text:

The naked bodies of a mother and her teen daughter have been found buried in an abandoned house in Argentina. 
The pair were found wrapped in bags and tied up with ropes in the town of Punta Lara, in the eastern Argentine province of Buenos Aires. 
The victims were identified as Peruvian nationals Maruja Chacon Perez, 50, and Shirley Cielo Barrientos, 15. 
A short distance from the metre-deep (3-foot) hole the bodies were found in, police found the teen’s underwear and a bloody knife . 
Police are investigating the cause of death and are hunting a suspect, Hugo Orlando Hidalgo, 40, believed to be the mother’s boyfriend. Read More Fiance accused of murdering author Helen Bailey cries as he tells jury two mystery men kidnapped her The pair were found wrapped in bags and tied up with ropes (Photo: CEN) 
Investigating prosecutor Marcelo Romero said the police investigation started after relatives reported the women’s disappearance, having heard nothing from them since 28th January. 
The elder victim’s son Douglas Barrientos gave a somewhat confusing account to local media of an audio recording made by one of his mother’s friends. 
He said the friend had called his mother after her disappearance, recording the conversation. On the recording, above the sound of a television in the background, his mother can be heard to say: "Please, I do not want to die." 
It was not clear whether the friend realised what was being said at the time. 
Barrientos believes that the murders of his mother and teen sister are related to human trafficking, as they might have died trying to protect themselves from being sold. Read More Mum let boyfriend beat young son to death - over a piece of missing birthday cake Ms Perez's boyfriend is being hunted over the murders (Photo: CEN) 
The mother and the daughter were living in the Argentine city of Ensenada, and her other, older children were living in the Peruvian capital Lima, where they received money from them. 
The victim’s other daughter, Kimberley, said that her mother had met Hidalgo two months ago, and that he had offered her a job as a cleaner and told her that she was going to earn a lot of money. 
She said of Hidalgo, also known as ‘Ninja’, that he seemed "a kind man". 
"He told me ‘I am going to take care of your mother and your sister, do not worry’", Kimberley added. 
Douglas Barrientos, who is also the brother of the teen victim, said: "I am sad because of my little sister, because she will not get to have a life." 
The investigation is ongoing.
